title: BOSS MBA ranking 2019: how we did it
text:
Since 2007, AFR BOSS magazine has published a biennial ranking of Australian business schools’ MBA and Executive MBA programs. In 2019, this review was managed in partnership with market research agency GfK.

The 2019 BOSS MBA ranking methodology is a replication of 2017’s, with minor changes.

Graduates and business schools were surveyed separately for the 2019 BOSS MBA rankings. Andrew Quilty

Results are based on findings from two surveys – one from schools, one from alumni – to ensure the programs are evaluated from both perspectives. Data from alumni is weighted at 55 per cent, and school data at 45 per cent.

This year we attempted to incorporate recent changes in MBA education while maintaining consistency with previous years.

Revisions were made to both surveys and divided into two categories: minor changes that could have an implication on the ranking, and those that do not affect the ranking.
description: Results are based on findings from two surveys – one from schools, one from alumni – to ensure the programs are evaluated from both perspectives.
